name: Truly Crispy Oven Baked Chicken Wings
description: VIDEO above in post. Learn how EASY it is to make SERIOUSLY Crispy Oven Baked Wings! The secret is tossing the wings in baking powder and baking it on low first to render out the fat before increasing the heat to very high to make the skin crispy. Serve these with one of the SAUCES in the notes. Also see FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS below the recipe.
recipeIngredient: 4 lb / 2 kg  chicken wings (, cut into wingettes and drumettes (Note 1))
5 teaspoons baking powder (NOT BAKING SODA / BI-CARB SODA!!)

itemListElement.text: If you are organised enough, uncover the chicken wings and leave them in the fridge for a few hours to dry out. Otherwise, use a paper towel to pat the wings dry.
itemListElement.name: If you are organised enough, uncover the chicken wings and leave them in the fridge for a few hours to dry out. Otherwise, use a paper towel to pat the wings dry.

itemListElement.text: Adjust oven racks to upper-middle and lower-middle positions.
itemListElement.name: Adjust oven racks to upper-middle and lower-middle positions.

itemListElement.text: Preheat oven to 250F/120C (all oven types - standard/convection/fan).
itemListElement.name: Preheat oven to 250F/120C (all oven types - standard/convection/fan).

itemListElement.text: Line a baking tray with foil, then place a rack (like a cooling rack) on the foil. Spray the rack with oil spray.
itemListElement.name: Line a baking tray with foil, then place a rack (like a cooling rack) on the foil. Spray the rack with oil spray.

itemListElement.text: Place wings in a large bowl or in a ziplock bag. Add the baking powder and salt, then toss to coat evenly.
itemListElement.name: Place wings in a large bowl or in a ziplock bag. Add the baking powder and salt, then toss to coat evenly.

itemListElement.text: Place the wings on the baking tray in a single layer with the skin side up. They should just fit snugly. They will shrink when they cook because the fat renders out so don't worry if they look too snug.
itemListElement.name: Place the wings on the baking tray in a single layer with the skin side up. They should just fit snugly. They will shrink when they cook because the fat renders out so don't worry if they look too snug.

itemListElement.text: Place wings on the lower middle oven rack and bake for 30 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Place wings on the lower middle oven rack and bake for 30 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Move wings up to the upper middle rack and increase the oven temperature to 425F/220C. Bake for 40 - 50 minutes, rotating the tray halfway through.
itemListElement.name: Move wings up to the upper middle rack and increase the oven temperature to 425F/220C. Bake for 40 - 50 minutes, rotating the tray halfway through.

itemListElement.text: Remove baking tray from the oven and let it stand for 5 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Remove baking tray from the oven and let it stand for 5 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Toss wings in sauce of choice or serve it on the side to dip / drizzle on the wings, then serve.
itemListElement.name: Toss wings in sauce of choice or serve it on the side to dip / drizzle on the wings, then serve.

review.reviewBody: Not yet out of bed on this Super Bowl Sunday and pulling this recipe up was the first thing I did today! I’ve made these for years now and they’re perfect every single time!

These are the BEST wings I've ever made. I make them over and over again. I have printed this recipe at least twice now, and probably will the next time it gets destroyed in the kitchen. These wings are so crispy, and so juicy, and just delicious. My husband asks for them all the time. Thank you, Nagi! Your recipes are always top notch!
Party Pack wings and drumlets,  This has been my goto recipie everytime, Thank you Nagi. I do use garlic salt and onion and Bluecheese Dip.  YUM!
When mixing ingredients make sure you are using baking powder and not baking soda. Straight baking soda will not taste good.
This recipe worked perfectly, you have changed my life! :-) I recently moved to a new country and can't find good wings anywhere here. Now I can make restaurant quality wings at home. Thank you!!!
I’ve made these many times, with both whole wings and split wings, and they turn out perfectly every time.

Came out perfect - but at 425 you will get smoke from chicken drippings (even after I changed the bottom pan after the 350 step). That's chemistry. I will make these again, but step two will be lower and slower.

Anyway, all's well that ends with a crunch. Five stars.
We loved these. I tossed them in a honey garlic sauce. (from a bottle!) The texture of the skin is indeed crispy, like deep fried but healthier. Yay!
The best wings I have ever made, finally! No more gooey, wet wings. Hallelujah!

Made these twice in the space of one week. Both times they worked out fantastically. My mother, who cannot stand chicken wings, even said they were amazing! I got told that next time I make them I have to double the quantity. 

I also made the barbecue sauce from your pork ribs recipe to serve with them… Delicious!
